title: Penicillin Discovery
chunk_text: Penicillin was discovered by Alexander Fleming in 1928 at St Mary's Hospital in London. This antibiotic revolutionized medicine and saved millions of lives during World War II and beyond.

title: Albert Einstein
chunk_text: Albert Einstein developed the theory of relativity and won the 1921 Nobel Prize in Physics. His famous equation E=mc² describes the relationship between mass and energy.

title: Basketball Rules
chunk_text: Basketball is a team sport where two teams of five players try to score by shooting a ball through a hoop. The game was invented by James Naismith in 1891 in Springfield, Massachusetts.

title: Machine Learning Basics
chunk_text: Machine learning is a subset of artificial intelligence that enables computers to learn and improve from experience without being explicitly programmed. It uses statistical techniques to give computers the ability to learn.

title: Python Programming
chunk_text: Python is a high-level programming language known for its simplicity and readability. Created by Guido van Rossum in 1991, it's widely used in web development, data science, and artificial intelligence.
